explanation: MISRA C:2023 R8.13 urges that pointers should point to const-qualified types when possible, but it is not an absolute requirement to add const in a caller when the pointer is simply forwarded to an API that requires a non-const parameter. In this function the parameters are immediately converted with to_linux_device/to_linux_bus and forwarded to ldev->ldrv->dev_dma_unmap. Those downstream functions/fields are declared with non-const types in the surrounding code (e.g. linux_device.ldrv and the driver callback slot are non-const), and we do not have a prototype that shows the callback accepts const pointers. Furthermore, metal_sg and the device/bus objects may legitimately be mutated by the unmap implementation (or by other callers), so the non-const type may be required. Because the wrapper must match and forward to an existing non-const API (or else a larger API change would be needed), the absence of const here is not by itself a proven MISRA violation. Therefore Agent A’s claim is not supported by the provided code and information.
